snippet: The Oscar-winning movie was pulled on its opening day despite reports that the filmmakers had edited scenes to comply with the wishes of Chinese censors.
abstract: Chinese authorities abruptly pull Quentin Tarantino film Django Unchained from theaters on opening day, providing no explanation; surprising move underscores fragility of Hollywood’s evolving relationship with Chinese movie industry.

byline.original: By GERRY MULLANY and MICHAEL CIEPLY
byline.contributor: Gerry Mullany reported from Hong Kong and Michael Cieply from New York. Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Amy Qin and Sue-Lin Wong contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The Oscar-winning movie was pulled on its opening day despite reports that the filmmakers had edited scenes to comply with the wishes of Chinese censors.

headline.seo: ‘Django Unchained’ Is Pulled From China’s Theaters
headline.main: At 11th Hour, China’s Censors Bar ‘Django Unchained’
headline.print_headline: At 11th Hour, China’s Censors Bar ‘Django Unchained’
